snippet: The punishment, considered unprecedented in modern Marine Corps history, came after an insurgent attack in Afghanistan in 2012 killed two Marines and destroyed six fighter jets.
abstract: Senior Marine Corps generals Charles M Gurganus and Gregg A Sturdevant are ordered to take early retirement after being found responsible for errors in judgement and failure to provide adequate security at base in southwestern Afghanistan; punishment, considered unprecedented in modern Marine Corps history, comes after insurgent attack in 2012 that killed two Marines and destroyed six fighter jets.
lead_paragraph: The punishment, considered unprecedented in modern Marine Corps history, came after an insurgent attack in Afghanistan in 2012 killed two Marines and destroyed six fighter jets.

headline.main: Two Marine Corps Generals Are Forced to Retire Over Fatal Security Breach
headline.print_headline: Two Marine Corps Generals Are Forced to Retire Over Fatal Security Breach

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
